Key Match Events: Michael Siani hit a tiebreaking two-run single in the 12th inning
Willy Adames hit a two-out RBI double in the 11th for Milwaukee
Paul Goldschmidt homered for St. Louis, who has a 10-game hitting streak
Post-Match Reflections: St. Louis manager Oliver Marmol said 'I just love the way they are going about it right now. You're going to lose some, you're going to win some, but just the mentality and overall effort and focus. Tough win, I liked it.'
Milwaukee manager Pat Murphy said 'You credit the St. Louis pitching, if you want, because I think they did a really nice job.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Siani nearly made an outstanding diving catch on Adames' liner to center, but the ball squirted out of his glove
All-Star William Contreras went 0 for 4 and is hitless with five walks in his last 14 at-bats
Others: The Cardinals won for the third time in four games to move back over.500 at 70-69
The Brewers had won six of seven before the loss
